connector.description: Receive data from Kafka topics with SSL/TLS support

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.topic.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.topic
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.bootstrap.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.bootstrapServers
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.bootstrap.description: Comma separated list of Kafka Broker URLs

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.securityP.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.securityProtocol
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.securityP.description: Protocol used to communicate with brokers. SASL_PLAINTEXT, PLAINTEXT, SASL_SSL and SSL are supported

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.saslMecha.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.saslMechanism
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.saslMecha.description: The Simple Authentication and Security Layer (SASL) Mechanism used.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoCommi.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoCommitEnable
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoCommi.description: If true, periodically commit to ZooKeeper the offset of messages already fetched by the consumer

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.allowManu.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.allowManualCommit
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.allowManu.description: Whether to allow doing manual commits

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.pollOnErr.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.pollOnError
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.pollOnErr.description: What to do if kafka threw an exception while polling for new messages. There are 5 enums and the value can be one of DISCARD, ERROR_HANDLER, RECONNECT, RETRY, STOP

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoOffse.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoOffsetReset
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.autoOffse.description: What to do when there is no initial offset. There are 3 enums and the value can be one of latest, earliest, none

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.consumerG.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.consumerGroup
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.consumerG.description: A string that uniquely identifies the group of consumers to which this source belongs Example: my-group-id

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.deseriali.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.deserializeHeaders
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.deseriali.description: When enabled the Kamelet source will deserialize all message headers to String representation.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeyPas.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeyPassword
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeyPas.description: The password of the private key in the key store file.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeysto.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeystorePassword
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeysto.description: The store password for the key store file.This is optional for client and only needed if ssl.keystore.location is configured.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslProtoc.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslProtocol
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslProtoc.description: The SSL protocol used to generate the SSLContext. Default setting is TLS, which is fine for most cases. Allowed values in recent JVMs are TLS, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. SSL, SSLv2 and SSLv3 may be supported in older JVMs, but their usage is discouraged due to known security vulnerabilities.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeysto.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeystoreLocation
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslKeysto.description: The location of the key store file. This is optional for client and can be used for two-way authentication for client.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslTrusts.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslTruststoreLocation
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslTrusts.description: The location of the trust store file.

camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslEnable.name: camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslEnabledProtocols
camel.kamelet.kafka-ssl-source.sslEnable.description: The list of protocols enabled for SSL connections. TLSv1.2, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1 are enabled by default.
